main_definition: To change or alter something significantly, often in a way that makes it look different or function differently.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To convert or change the shape, form, or nature of something completely.
meanings_and_examples.example: The caterpillar will transform into a butterfly through metamorphosis.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cause to undergo a marked and profound change in character or appearance.
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of hard work, he transformed from a shy teenager into a confident adult.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To turn something into another form or state.
meanings_and_examples.example: The old factory was transformed into luxury apartments.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To change the function, purpose, or nature of something.
meanings_and_examples.example: Through technological advancements, coal-fired power plants can be transformed to generate clean energy.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing and programming, to convert data from one format into another.
meanings_and_examples.example: The software will transform the raw text file into a readable document.
